section.section: Before issuing bonds under Part II of this subtitle, a municipal authority shall submit to a referendum of the voters of the municipality the question of whether to issue the bonds.

The referendum shall be held at:
Any regular municipal election; or
A special municipal election, provided that the voters are given at least 20 days' notice of the election.
The referendum ballot shall include the words "for ... bonds" and "against ... bonds".
If a majority of the votes cast are "for ... bonds", the municipal authority may issue the bonds.

If a majority of the votes cast are "against ... bonds", the municipal authority:
May not issue the bonds; but
May submit the question at any later regular or special municipal election as provided under this section, until a majority of the votes cast is "for ... bonds".
